item.title: Report E-2024040610
item.description:
Report E-2024040610

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-29T15:12:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-25
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LDA experienced a UN1993 Glycol Ether EB release from a 330-gallon poly tote while at the customer location. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of product released to a 2’ x 2’ area of the trailer floor due to a crack on the top corner of the tote. The material was transferred into a new poly tote and then provided to the customer. The impacted area was cleaned with absorbent pads. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum along with all spent absorbent pads. The waste removed from site pending disposal.

  • Description: One bottle came in contact with a sharp item at some point during the AM shift. The bottle has a small hole near the cap. Due to the hole the bottle will leak corrosive liquid every time it is tilted over. The other three bottles are not damaged and is still in good shipping condition.

item.title: Report E-2024040529
item.description:
Report E-2024040529

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-25T15:11:03+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-22
  • City: IRVING
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Lone Star Hazmat Response was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 6ft-by-1ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that one (1) quart of material was released due improper loading of the freight that resulted in one (1) 15-gallon plastic jug to overturn and leak. Lone Star Hazmat Response personnel deployed a neutralizer to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum along with impacted cardboard and plastic wrap. The 15-gallon plastic jug was inspected, and no damage was observed. The jugs bung was tightened and shipped onto the consignee. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024040475
item.description:
Report E-2024040475

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-24T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-16
  • City: BAYTOWN
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While offloading a shipment at Veolia's ten day intransit facility in Baytown, TX, it was discovered that there were a few pallets with three drums on them loaded into the truck at the shipper's location. As a result one drum was not completely blocked in and toppled over during transit. Material leaked from the bung hole onto the trailer floor. Before picking up the drum to its upright position, the bung was tightened to prevent further leakage.
